metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5018 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M9, 8.5.0 to 8.5.4, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.36, 7.0.0 to 7.0.70 and 6.0.0 to 6.0.45 a malicious web application was able to bypass a configured SecurityManager via a Tomcat utility method that was accessible to web applications.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8').
